description: Write a function to find the area of a rectangle given its length and width.
input_format: Two integers on the same line, separated by a space. The first integer represents the length, and the second represents the width of the rectangle.
output_format: A single integer representing the area of the rectangle, followed by a newline.
prompt:
; Write a function to find the area of a rectangle given its length and width.
; Input format: Two integers on the same line, separated by a space. The first integer represents the length, and the second represents the width of the rectangle.
; Output format: A single integer representing the area of the rectangle, followed by a newline.

#lang racket
completions:
(define (rectangle-area length width)
  (* length width))

; Example usage:
; (rectangle-area 5 10) => 50
; (rectangle-area 7 3) => 21

(define (area length width)
  (* length width))

; Example usage:
; (area 5 10) => 50
; (area 7 3) => 21
